title: "Update Available" message keeps popping up.
content: Does the "Update Available" popup screen shown in the uploaded image come from Firefox? It keeps coming back it seems every time I open Firefox. I clicked "Update" a few times, but Firefox never got updated, as far as I can tell. I tried turning off NordVPN but that does not allow an update to occur. Now I just click "Dismiss" if I need to see what's behind the popup. You have to click either "Update" or Dismiss" to get it to go away. There is no "x" at the upper right on the popup screen, which would allow you to close the screen without clicking either "Update" or "Dismiss". I worry that by clicking on either I am downloading some malware. William F Briel
creator: wfpb94

title: Want to delete saved username from Yahoo Mail drop down login list
content:
Firefox 89.0.2 on Mac: Have accidentally saved my password as the username when logging in to yahoo mail. Now I can't delete it. Shift-delete does not work, nor does Delete. Tried deleting cookies, history, restarting Firefox. Nothing works!

Appreciate any suggestions. TIA

title: Unwanted update.
content: I installed an earlier version of Mozilla Foxfire and checked off that I did not want my version to be updated to the latest version. I now see that my version of choice has been updated without my knowledge or consent. How do I uninstall the unwanted update and how do I keep it from happening over and over again?
